cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 125 mi SSW of Great Exuma Island, or 370 mi ESE of Key West, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest along or just north of Cuba, forecast to turn northwest on Saturday and track toward the Florida Keys and then up the west coast of Florida into the eastern Gulf
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west coast of Florida (likely between Fort Myers and Florida Big Bend)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Southwest coast of Florida from Englewood south and east to Ocean Reef, including Florida Bay
weather_observation.warning_coast: Florida Keys west of Ocean Reef to the Dry Tortugas and Florida Bay
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire west coast of Florida from the Keys northward to the Big Bend region
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (34–45 mph) possible Sunday, with gusts locally higher.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft of surge possible along the west-central Florida coast, including Tampa Bay.
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–7 inches likely with isolated totals up to 10 inches, beginning Saturday night and peaking Sunday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents along area beaches.
